Info.EN: She's an early riser.
Info.DE: Sie ist eine Frühaufsteherin.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Smells like the bottom of the sea.
Info.DE: Riecht wie der Meeresboden.

Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your crew stick stoically to the same story. "This man?" the officials say, holding up a picture of their new friend, "have you seen him?" "Oh no, no," your sailors reply. Still, the officials conduct a cursory search, but the man of many talents has no difficulty hiding from them. When they have gone, there is a hearty cheer. "Glad to have you with us!" bellows the Captain. You have a new recruit!

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.2.1
Source.Text: You have a new recruit! "You are welcome to him!" says the more senior of the two officials brightly, "we had no idea he was so important to you." His colleague glances at him nervously, before wrinkling up a fake smile of his own. It is obvious they only discontinue their pursuit because your vessel is far more powerful than theirs. With your ship free to continue, the former fugitive raises a glass, "thank you all" he says, "here's to a triumphant expedition, and beyond!"

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.3.1.1.1
Source.Text: You have a new recruit! "I will repay your trust in me tenfold!" says the talented fellow, as the local authority departs with their payment. He raises a beaker of navy rum, "thank you all. Here's to a triumphant expedition, and beyond!"

Info.EN: Knows his nightcrawlers from his lobworms.
Info.DE: Kann Köderwürmer von Regenwürmern unterscheiden.

One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Asset.Name: Captain Moby, Old Dog of the Sea

Text.EN: Captain Moby, Old Dog of the Sea

Info.EN: A man who will pursue cetacean prey to the ends of the earth, even if his own life be forfeit.
Info.DE: Ein Mann, der Wale bis ans Ende der Welt jagt, und sollte es ihn auch das Leben kosten.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your crew stick stoically to the same story. "This man?" the officials say, holding up a picture of their new friend, "have you seen him?" "Oh no, no," your sailors reply. Still, the officials conduct a cursory search, but the man of many talents has no difficulty hiding from them. When they have gone, there is a hearty cheer. "Glad to have you with us!" bellows the Captain. You have a new recruit!

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.2.1
Source.Text: You have a new recruit! "You are welcome to him!" says the more senior of the two officials brightly, "we had no idea he was so important to you." His colleague glances at him nervously, before wrinkling up a fake smile of his own. It is obvious they only discontinue their pursuit because your vessel is far more powerful than theirs. With your ship free to continue, the former fugitive raises a glass, "thank you all" he says, "here's to a triumphant expedition, and beyond!"

Source.Name: The Runaway 1.3.1.1.1
Source.Text: You have a new recruit! "I will repay your trust in me tenfold!" says the talented fellow, as the local authority departs with their payment. He raises a beaker of navy rum, "thank you all. Here's to a triumphant expedition, and beyond!"

Info.EN: Has a fair degree of patience.
Info.DE: Hat eine ganze Menge Geduld.

Info.DE: Man glaubt nicht, was sie alles mit einem Spritzbeutel anfangen kann.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: If you can stand his infamous temper, his "Crème Pat" is to die for.
Info.DE: Falls Sie sein berüchtigtes Temperament aushalten, ist seine Vanillecreme ein Traum.

Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: His friends are the barrels.
Info.DE: Seine Freunde sind die Fässer

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Info.DE: Mills verspeist glühende Kohlen zum Frühstück und spült sie mit kochend heißem Tee herunter.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Dubbed "Dragonproof", Doughty once tackled a Pyrphorian blaze bare-chested, having given his vest to an orphan.
Info.DE: Einst bekämpfte „Drachenfeuer“ Doughty ein flammendes Inferno mit blanker Brust, nachdem er seine Weste einer Waisen gegeben hatte.

Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Hermann's favourite tree is the Black Locust, whose long dark pods fall in autumn.
Info.DE: Hermanns Lieblingsbaum ist die Robinie, deren lange dunkle Hülsen im Herbst abgeworfen werden.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Text.EN: Dr. Ali Al-Zahir, the Botanical Director

Info.EN: Fruit-bearing or otherwise, Dr Al-Zahir's trees are living sculptures, each with distinct personalities.
Info.DE: Ob sie Früchte tragen oder nicht, Dr. Al-Zahirs Bäume sind lebende Skulpturen mit individuellen Persönlichkeiten.

Info.EN: Zanchi invented the steel process, so perhaps he has every right to be as ruthless and proud as he always appears.
Info.DE: Zanchi hat das Verfahren der Stahlherstellung revolutioniert und damit jedes Recht erworben, sein rücksichtsloses Verhalten zu legitimieren.

Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: His door is always left open.
Info.DE: Seine Tür bleibt immer geöffnet.

Source.Name: Love Island 1.1.1
Source.Text: The king is not only surprised, but moved to tears by the romantic composers he hears via the gramophone. He insists on a grand banquet to celebrate the union of his children and your crew. Both traditional music and a few cranks of the newfangled gramophone accompany the beautiful ceremony, and then its bon voyage!

Source.Name: Love Island 1.2.1
Source.Text: The king is delighted to see his children wed. Delicate understanding of local custom and a smattering of their language allow a message of true love to be conveyed. The king evidently thinks his children in good hands. Feasting, and to the amusement of all, terrible dancing, follows. For his departing children, it shall be the longest, most fascinating honeymoon.

Source.Name: Love Island 1.3.1
Source.Text: The copper oracle sees only purity in your crew's hearts. It predicts a bounteous future for the king's children, and so with tearful pride, he gives the couples his blessing. The traditional ceremony is both spiritually uplifting and wholesome.

Info.EN: Whistling while he works, Dr. Salvador always puts his patients at ease.
Info.DE: Dr. Salvador pfeift bei der Arbeit und schafft es, dass seine Patienten immer ganz entspannt sind.

Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Straw man.
Info.DE: Strohmann.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Love Island 1.1.1
Source.Text: The king is not only surprised, but moved to tears by the romantic composers he hears via the gramophone. He insists on a grand banquet to celebrate the union of his children and your crew. Both traditional music and a few cranks of the newfangled gramophone accompany the beautiful ceremony, and then its bon voyage!

Source.Name: Love Island 1.2.1
Source.Text: The king is delighted to see his children wed. Delicate understanding of local custom and a smattering of their language allow a message of true love to be conveyed. The king evidently thinks his children in good hands. Feasting, and to the amusement of all, terrible dancing, follows. For his departing children, it shall be the longest, most fascinating honeymoon.

Source.Name: Love Island 1.3.1
Source.Text: The copper oracle sees only purity in your crew's hearts. It predicts a bounteous future for the king's children, and so with tearful pride, he gives the couples his blessing. The traditional ceremony is both spiritually uplifting and wholesome.

Info.EN: Miss Rodriguez knows deforestation will be a topic in the future.
Info.DE: Miss Rodriguez weiß, dass Abholzung ein Thema der Zukunft sein wird.

Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Habitually plants with depth probes and measuring tape.
Info.DE: Pflanzt gewöhnlich mit Tiefbohrung und Maßband.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Info.EN: Farming is both a tradition and a science, Yvonne takes a smattering of both.
Info.DE: Ackerbau ist sowohl Tradition als auch Wissenschaft und mit beidem kennt sich Yvonne halbwegs aus.

Info.DE: Sprengt nur, wenn alle Vorsichtsmaßnahmen ergriffen wurden.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Micaela's ambition is really just to save a few lives down there.
Info.DE: Micaela würde alles tun, um das Leben eines Kumpels zu retten.

Asset.Name: James W. Marshall - The Gold Discoverer

Text.EN: Jörg von Malching, Augur of the Auric
Text.DE: Jörg von Malching, Augur des Aurum

Info.EN: Jörg always seems to be first on the scene before the gold rush begins in earnest. Has the heart of cousin Carl.
Info.DE: Jörg scheint immer als Erster am Ort des Geschehens zu sein, bevor der eigentliche Goldrausch einsetzt. Hat das Herz seines Vetters Carl.

Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Doesn't let soap become a drama.
Info.DE: Bei ihr wird Seife nicht zur Oper.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Text.DE: Hans Klein, der alte Großvater Zeit

Text.EN: Instead of its usual workforce, the building employs Worker Workforce

Info.EN: Lady Hunt insists the great Klein service her house clocks every third Tuesday, just as her late husband had it.
Info.DE: Lady Hunt schwört auf seine Dienste. Seit dem Tode ihres letzten Gemahls obliegt es Hannes, alle Uhren im Hause Hunt zu aufzuziehen.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: A clothes moth.
Info.DE: Eine Kleidermotte.

Info.EN: Franke is an alchemist of textiles, in his dedication, skilled artistry and years of experience, turning fur to cotton and back again!

Source.Name: Boris_BeyondTheHorizon3
Source.Text: Beyond The Horizon 3 - Come Together

Text.EN: Lady Jane Smythe, Queen of Haute Couture
Text.DE: Lady Jane Smythe, Königin der Haute Couture

Info.EN: Lady Smythe has seen a world of colour, she wishes to unite— and by so doing, create fashions entirely new.
Info.DE: Lady Smythes Mode eröffnet eine Welt voller Farben, die so noch nie gesehen wurde.

Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: A textile worker.
Info.DE: Eine Textilarbeiterin.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Info.EN: The one true couturier, his designs turn out their wearer's souls. Never ask him how Malching's fitting went.

Info.EN: Has a sweet tooth.
Info.DE: Ist eine Naschkatze.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Absolutely bananas.
Info.DE: Vollkommen Banane.

Asset.Name: Rodolphe Lindt - The Swiss Chocolate Inventor

Text.EN: Gennaro Garibaldi, Chocolatier by Royal Appointment

Info.EN: "Your hare is chocolate fondue!" shrieked the young Queen, as she pushed his 7-metre "Osterhase" into the fire.
Info.DE: „Schokoladenfondue!“, kreischte die junge Königin, als sie versehentlich seinen sieben Meter großen Osterhasen ins Feuer stieß.

Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1

The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Text.EN: Prof. Ram Devi, The Bundle of Energy

Info.EN: Conducts lightning. His family (from Wittenberg) has the motto, "standing still is a backward step."

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: He's got a licence to distill.
Info.DE: Hat eine Lizenz zum Destillieren.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Text.EN: Tlayolotl Savor, King of the Corn

Info.EN: Like a true son of the earth goddess, Tlayolotl plants by the ancient calendar, and the corn grows like crazy.
Info.DE: Wie ein wahrer Sohn der Erdgöttin pflanzt Tlayolotl getreu dem alten Kalender und der Mais wächst und gedeiht.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: Chop-chop!
Info.DE: Hack-zack!

Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.
