Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: A stitch in time…
Info.DE: Ein Griff zur rechten Zeit ...

Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Asset.Name: Isambard Kingdom Brunel - The Engineering Giant

Info.EN: Only Ironbright's contributions to modern engineering can be said to have been utterly groundbreaking.
Info.DE: Ironbrights bahnbrechende Beiträge haben massiv zum modernen Ingenieurswesen beigetragen.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.DE: Lässt niemals gutes Holz verrotten.

They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: There's a lot of risk in farming, but she knows how to manage it.
Info.DE: Die Tierzucht birgt viele Risiken, doch sie weiß damit umzugehen.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Asset.Name: Max von Stephanitz - The German Shepherd Breeder

Text.EN: Mark van der Mark, Breeder of Shepherd Dogs
Text.DE: Mark van der Mark, Züchter von Schäferhunden

Info.EN: Van der Mark's breeds working dogs to a standard, with the wits and wolfish look to bring home the herd.
Info.DE: Van der Mark züchtet intelligente, wölfisch aussehende Schäferhunde, die eine Herde hüten können.

Source.Text: The breeches buoy guarantees a safe rescue. The crew transform a lifebuoy into a harness, attached to runners which allow it to zip between the two ships once the harpoon rope is drawn taut. The stranded sailors take turns to enjoy this rather daring form of escape. Having been lifted from the doldrums, they are keen to assist however they may for the remainder of the expedition.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.2.1.2.1
Source.Text: A surge of belief animates the stranded sailors. "You are saved!" cries your lookout, "your penance is over!" Under the encouragement of your lieutenants the other crew grab the rope, and with the desperate strength of hope, they cross the distance to reach your ship. Your crew's good will has shone through, the grateful survivors join your expedition without a second thought.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.1.1
Source.Text: Your ship avoids the deadly reefs and finds the castaways! The vessel groans as it swims through the limpid waters, the deepest corals reflecting its shadow as it avoids them. It takes a short while to find the castaways, entrenched among the dunes of a secluded beach and sprouting from it with squeals of joy and disbelief. Their captain offers his unalienable loyalty and your crew gladly welcomes the newcomers.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.1.2.1
Source.Text: Found them! Your look-out shows their brilliance when they spot the thin smoke line of a campfire in the distance. A dinghy is sent to retrieve the castaways and comes back filled to the brim with men in overgrown beards, torn clothes, and awed faces. Their captain pledges himself to your crew and, once shaved and washed, the castaways prove themselves to be excellent sailors and even better companions.

Source.Name: Bottles Found in the Sea 1.1.2.1.1
Source.Text: Relentless faith guides the most deserving. In the spilled gut of the shark, your navigators see the shapes of islands, your doctors see the patterns of life forms, your boatswain sees the promise of rewards. Driven by an inner force beyond simple greed, the crew sails past coral reefs and insidious currents and finds the island on which the castaways had been waiting for rescue. Their relief is glorious and their captain promises to serve your crew!

Source.Name: Ghosts in the Ice 1.1.1.2.1.1.1
Source.Text: The ship is freed! Your artillery men take hold of the stranded ship's cannons, ordering the crew in their handling of the frozen artillery and coordinating them with your own firepower. The combined shots from both vessels trace the contours of the ice, breaking it with successive volleys until the floe parts and lets go under the united cheer of both crews. One of the sailors who helped shooting, taken with your crew's kindness and its brilliant skills, even offers to join it.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Info.EN: He crossed Mount Macleod so many times to make sure his survey was accurate, that they named it after him.
Info.DE: Er hat den Mount Macleod so oft überquert, um sich zu vergewissern, dass seine Vermessung exakt ist, dass der Berg nach ihm benannt wurde.

Source.Name: Sea Still 1.1.1
Source.Text: Your steamer glides effortlessly through. The crew lean from the rails to peer at the sargassum colony, which is thick with sealife such as crab and tropical fish. The algae parts easily before your ship. The absence of wind presents no difficulty as it would for a sailboat; and indeed the crew of the ship in distress explain as you tug them into open water, it was not the algae but the calm that had stalled them. They are delighted to have been discovered, and several of them offer to join your expedition.

Text.DE: Sir Lewis Brindley, Chemiker mit Verstand

Info.EN: Sir Lewis has explored and refined every distillation method known to mankind.
Info.DE: Sir Lewis hat alle der Menschheit bekannten Destillationsmethoden ausprobiert und verfeinert.

Info.EN: Feras' voice puts people in a comforting trance, to lead happier, more focused and productive lives.
Info.DE: Feras Stimme versetzt Menschen in beruhigende Trance, damit sie ein glücklicheres, zielstrebigeres und produktiveres Leben führen können.

Info.EN: Hancock has spent his life travelling in search of the perfect potato. He's sieved most of the known world for the perfect soil and spud varieties, and now sells his secrets to the highest bidder (payment in potato accepted).
Info.DE: Hancocks Lebenstraum ist die perfekte Kartoffel. Für dieses Ziel bereiste er die bekannte Welt und nahm Proben verschiedenster Erden und Sorten. Der Erfolg gibt ihm recht. Kunden zahlen für seine Erkenntnisse Höchstpreise, wobei Alexander auch neue Kartoffeln akzeptiert.

Info.EN: Reduces the risk of fire.
Info.DE: Vermindert die Brandgefahr.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.1
Source.Text: The Inspector's lip wobbles. "I beg you," he says, "I have a gift, if only you will spare us." Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.3.1
Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Investors_Productivity
Source.Text: Man Vs Machine

Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Investors_Productivity
Source.Text: Man Vs Machine

Source.Name: RQ_Engineers_Invention
Source.Text: Proof Of The Pudding

Source.Name: 9 Unique Inventions
Source.Text: Unique Inventions

Info.EN: Smelts the candle at both ends.
Info.DE: Schmilzt die Kerze an beiden Enden.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.1
Source.Text: The Inspector's lip wobbles. "I beg you," he says, "I have a gift, if only you will spare us." Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.

Source.Name: Teeth of the Mountain 1.1.1.2.2.2.1
Source.Text: Where discretion fails, force prevails. Your crew is unfazed by the singular appearance of the villagers and springs into action. Their villagers expressions remain resolute, even as they flee up the mountain to take refuge with the condors. But there is sadness behind those eyes; this isn't fair. Your men loot the village.

Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Investors_Productivity
Source.Text: Man Vs Machine

Source.Name: 1 Basic Tools
Source.Text: Basic Tools

Source.Name: Teeth of the Mountain 1.1.1.2.2.2.1
Source.Text: Where discretion fails, force prevails. Your crew is unfazed by the singular appearance of the villagers and springs into action. Their villagers expressions remain resolute, even as they flee up the mountain to take refuge with the condors. But there is sadness behind those eyes; this isn't fair. Your men loot the village.

Info.EN: Keeping pruning tradition alive.
Info.DE: Hält die Tradition des Zurückschneidens am Leben.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Investors_Productivity
Source.Text: Man Vs Machine

Source.Name: 6 High End Equipment
Source.Text: High-End Equipment

Source.Name: 4 Advanced Tools
Source.Text: Advanced Tools

Info.EN: Performing solely on electricity, the Simmons has no rival in ferrying things up and down at break-neck speed!
Info.DE: Simmons' neue elektrischer Aufzug ist vollelektronisch und konkurrenzlos bei der vertikalen Beförderung von Dingen in halsbrecherischem Tempo!

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.1
Source.Text: The Inspector's lip wobbles. "I beg you," he says, "I have a gift, if only you will spare us." Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.

Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Investors_Productivity
Source.Text: Man Vs Machine

Source.Name: 7 Powered Machines
Source.Text: Machines

Source.Name: Teeth of the Mountain 1.1.1.2.2.2.1
Source.Text: Where discretion fails, force prevails. Your crew is unfazed by the singular appearance of the villagers and springs into action. Their villagers expressions remain resolute, even as they flee up the mountain to take refuge with the condors. But there is sadness behind those eyes; this isn't fair. Your men loot the village.

Info.EN: They can't wait to get its teeth stuck into it.
Info.DE: Sie können es nicht erwarten, die Zähne ins Holz zu schlagen.

Info.DE: Diese ausgekeimten Kartoffeln helfen Ihnen, viele Kartoffelfelder auf fremdem Boden anzulegen.

Source.Name: Destroy Welcome to the creed 4 - Kahina
Source.Text: Welcome to the Truth 4 - The Answer

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.1
Source.Text: The Inspector's lip wobbles. "I beg you," he says, "I have a gift, if only you will spare us." Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.3.1
Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Engineers_Fertility
Source.Text: An Introduced Species

Source.Name: 5 Chemical Research
Source.Text: Chemical Research

Source.Name: 3 Common Seeds
Source.Text: Common Seeds

Info.EN: These sprouts have been adapted to grow in a very wide range of soils, and with increased Potato yield!
Info.DE: Diese ausgekeimten Kartoffeln wurden für das Wachstum auf einer breiten Vielfalt von Böden und einen gesteigerten Ertrag an Kartoffeln gezüchtet!

Info.EN: These beans have been adapted to grow in a very wide range of soils, and with increased Cocoa yield!
Info.DE: Diese Bohnen wurden für das Wachstum auf einer breiten Vielfalt von Böden und einen gesteigerten Ertrag an Kakao gezüchtet!

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.1
Source.Text: The Inspector's lip wobbles. "I beg you," he says, "I have a gift, if only you will spare us." Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.3.1
Source.Text: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.

Source.Name: The Inspector 1.2.3.2.1
Source.Text: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.

Source.Name: Reward Event Rescue Missions
Source.Text: You have earned a reward for your altruism! The crew toast a successful rescue, with all returning to the glad comforts of home.

Source.Name: RQ_Engineers_Fertility
Source.Text: An Introduced Species

Source.Name: 8 Agricultural Revolution
Source.Text: Agricultural Revolution

Info.EN: These saplings can help you grow a few groves of Caoutchouc in alien soil.
Info.DE: Diese Setzlinge helfen Ihnen, einige Kautschukfelder auf fremdem Boden anzulegen.

Source.Name: 8 Agricultural Revolution
Source.Text: Agricultural Revolution

Info.EN: Makes it look like your premises are all above board.
Info.DE: Lässt es so aussehen, als seien alle Ihre Anlagen einwandfrei.

Info.EN: You can make everything on the cheap and no-one has to know.
Info.DE: Sie können alles auf billige Art machen und niemand muss es erfahren.

Info.EN: Von Malching fought hard at council to ensure children might also enjoy supervisory roles in factories.
Info.DE: Von Malching hat im Rat schwer darum gekämpft, dafür zu sorgen, dass Kinder ebenfalls leitende Funktionen in Fabriken übernehmen können.

Info.EN: Fewer fires, for little cost.
Info.DE: Weniger Brände für geringe Kosten.

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Info.EN: An investment that provides your people the ways and means to combat a blaze.
Info.DE: Eine Investition, die Ihrem Volk Mittel und Wege an die Hand gibt, Brände zu bekämpfen.

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Info.EN: Better factory materials cost more money, but it's bound to be worth it in the end, argues Lord Fizgig.
Info.DE: Bessere Fabrikmaterialien kosten mehr Geld, aber am Ende werde es das wert sein, argumentiert Lord Fizgig.

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Info.EN: The world runs on miney, not oxygen!
Info.DE: Geld hält die Welt am Laufen, nicht Sauerstoff!

Info.EN: Don't let anybody stop you burning coal, even if it looks gruesome.
Info.DE: Lassen Sie sich von niemandem daran hindern, Kohle zu verfeuern, auch wenn es grauenhaft aussieht.

Info.EN: This is the era of industrialisation! To hell with the tree-hugging leaf-lickers! declares Lord Footprint.
Info.DE: Dies ist eine Ära der Industrialisierung! Zum Teufel mit diesen naturverliebten Umweltspinnern!, verkündet Lord Footprint.

Info.EN: Makes the city air cleaner at night.
Info.DE: Macht die Stadtluft bei Nacht sauberer.

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Info.EN: the difference to the city air, is night and day.
Info.DE: Der Unterschied für die Stadtluft ist wie Tag und Nacht.

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Text.EN: Green's Law to Postpone The Apocalypse
Text.DE: Greens Gesetz zur Aufschiebung der Apokalypse

Info.EN: Miss Green's clever measures to reduce smog can save our species from extinction!
Info.DE: Miss Greens clevere Maßnahmen zur Smog-Verminderung können unsere Spezies vor dem Aussterben bewahren!

Source.Name: Edict - George Smith
Source.Text: Read The Riot Act

Text.EN: Hans Graf - Of the Timeless Timepiece
Hans Graf - Of the Timeless Timepiece
Instead of its usual workforce, the building employs Investor Workforce
Text.DE: Statt der üblichen Arbeitskräfte beschäftigt das Gebäude Investoren-Arbeitskraft
